sentences: Mats Olof Gustafsson (born 29 October 1964) is a Swedish free jazz saxophone player.

Gustafsson came to the attention of lovers of improvised music as part of a duo with Christian Munthe (started in 1986), as member of Gunter Christmann's Vario project and the band Gush (started in 1988).

Since the early 1990s Gustafsson has been a regular visitor to the United States, forming a particular affinity with Chicago musicians Hamid Drake, Michael Zerang, and Ken Vandermark and recording for Okka Disk.
He was awarded the 2011 Nordic Council Music Prize.
He has lived in Nickelsdorf, Austria since 2011.
